page.title: 19BEAUTY SPOTS,CATON
page.content: The villages of Caton and Brookhouse are set in an area of natural beauty and there are many interesting and attractive walks and footpaths in the area. In recent years a disused railway line has been converted into a footpath and cycleway. Following,as it does,the course of the River Lune, the path affords many scenic views and is very popular. The Crook O'Lune attracts many visitors who come to picnic in this picturesque spot where the River Lune doubles back on itself.Bathing also is popular,though the river currents can be dangerous.Littledale Cragg is another site familiar to picnickers. Although most visitors take the easy route to the summit by car, the Cragg is used by rock climbers to sharpen their skills. Below the Cragg, the sparkling waters of Artlebeck flow through a delightful wooded valley.
